title: Mainly dry weather expected today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers may occur at several places in Galle, Matara, Kaluthara and Rathnapura districts in the evening or night.

title: Pope’s health a ‘complex clinical situation’, Vatican says
byline: Pope Francis is being treated for a “complex clinical situation” and will remain in hospital for as long as necessary, the Vatican has said.

title: Re-scrutinized results of 2023(24) O/L exam released
byline: The re-scrutinized results of the 2023 (2024) G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination have been released around midnight yesterday (17).

title: Delta plane flips upside down at Toronto airport, injuring 17
byline: A Delta Airlines plane flipped upon arrival at Toronto’s Pearson Airport and ended up on its roof Monday, injuring 17 people.

title: Maldives Foreign Minister to visit Sri Lanka today
byline: The Minister of Foreign Affairs of Maldives, Abdulla Khaleel will be undertaking an official visit to Sri Lanka from February 18 to February 21, 2025, Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Deputy Minister explains limited tax concessions in 2025 Budget
byline: Deputy Minister of Economic Development Prof. Anil Jayantha says that although the government’s intention was to provide tax concessions on essential goods, multiple limitations arose when presenting the 2025 Budget.

title: CEB explains causes of Feb. 9 blackout, announces long-term stability measures
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) states that it has implemented immediate and long-term measures to strengthen grid stability following the nationwide power failure on February 9, 2025.

title: Debate on Second Reading of 2025 Budget begins
byline: The debate on the Second Reading of 2025 Appropriation Bill, or the 79th Budget Speech, kicked off in parliament this morning (Feb.17).

title: Indictments filed against Namal Rajapaksa over ‘Krrish’ deal
byline: The Attorney General today filed indictments before the Colombo High Court against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa.

title: Namal served indictments over misappropriation of Rs. 70 million
byline: The Attorney General today filed indictments before the Colombo High Court against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa.

title: Price of bread reduced
byline: With the Rs. 10 price reduction on a kilogram of wheat flour, the bakery owners have agreed on a price reduction of Rs. 10 per loaf of bread, according to the Ministry of Trade.

title: Police officers seeking reinstatement to undergo mandatory drug testing
byline: Sri Lanka Police has announced that all officers seeking reinstatement after being inactive for any reason including suspension, must undergo mandatory drug testing before resuming active duty.

title: EC set to determine date for LG Polls
byline: The Election Commission convened this morning (18) to discuss the Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill, which was passed in Parliament yesterday (17).

title: Man arrested with three foreign-made firearms and ammo in Katunayake
byline: A 54-year-old suspect has been arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) for the illegal possession of firearms and live ammunition in the Heenatiyana area of the Katunayake Police Division.

title: ‘Father’ of Nutella, world’s most famous hazelnut spread, dies at 97
byline: Italian chemist Francesco Rivella, best known as the inventor of Nutella, died on Valentine’s Day, according to various news outlets. He was 97.

title: Vehicle imports unaffordable for most Sri Lankans - Harsha
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Parliamentarian Dr. Harsha de Silva states that given the current situation, importing vehicles poses a significant risk to Sri Lanka’s economy.

title: SJB’s internal crisis disrupts talks with UNP
byline: Ongoing talks between the United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) regarding a potential unification for the upcoming elections have been disrupted due to internal crises within the SJB.

title: IMF Executive Board to decide on Sri Lanka’s fourth tranche on Feb. 28
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is scheduled to meet on February 28, 2025 to discuss and approve third review of Sri Lanka’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) programme.

title: Indictments served against ex-Minister Piyankara over corruption charges
byline: Indictments have been served against former Minister Piyankara Jayaratne before the Colombo High Court today (18).

title: Sri Lanka’s Air quality drops across cities
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) indicates that the Air Quality Index (AQI) within next few days will be slightly unhealthy levels at most of the cities in the country.

title: Deputy Minister offers clarification on public sector salary hike
byline: The Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe today provided a clarification with regard to the process of salary increments to the public sector employees scheduled to be implemented as per the 2025 Budget proposals.

title: Heat index to reach ‘caution level’ in several areas tomorrow
byline: The Meteorology Department says that the Heat Index, the temperature felt on human body,  is expected to increase up to ‘Caution Level’ tomorrow (19) in the Northern, North-Central, North-Western, Western, and Southern Provinces and in Monaragala and Ratnapura districts.

title: Sajith urges to call LG election nominations after March 21
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has requested the Election Commission to commence the Local Government Election process after the final vote on the 2025 Budget, which is scheduled for March 21.

title: Former MP Shantha Abeysekara and son arrested
byline: Former Puttalam District MP Shantha Abeysekara and his son have been arrested by the Police Illegal Assets Investigations Division.

title: Two-day workshop to train trainers for “Clean Sri Lanka” program
byline: A two-day workshop to train 150 selected members of the Tri Forces and the Sri Lanka Police as trainers to properly implement the “Clean Sri Lanka” program commenced today (February 18) at the Sri Lanka Light Infantry Regimental Center premises in Panagoda, the Ministry of Defence said.

title: US and Russia conclude first talks without Ukraine, as Moscow makes new demand
byline: U.S. and Russian officials held more than four hours of talks in Riyadh on Tuesday, their first on ending the war in Ukraine, as Kyiv and its European allies watched anxiously from the sidelines and Moscow raised a major new demand. more..

title: CCC hails 2025 Budget’s ‘bold proposals’, commends govt for avoiding ad-hoc tax measures
byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC) has welcomed the “bold proposals” in the 2025 Budget, which it says align with its recommendations, Sri Lanka Economic Summit discussions, and Vision 2030 goals.

title: Farmers to promptly receive compensation for flood-damaged crops
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board says that measures will be taken to swiftly provide insurance compensation to farmers in districts that have not yet received payments for crops damaged by the floods last November during the 2024/25 ‘Maha Season’.

title: Chinese lithium company halts tech exports as trade tensions build
byline: A Chinese company has stopped exporting a piece of equipment used to process the electric vehicle battery metal lithium, in the clearest sign yet manufacturers are already implementing export controls proposed by Beijing.

title: Sri Lanka’s budget likely to lead to slower fiscal consolidation, Moody’s says
byline: Sri Lanka’s budgeted expenditure for 2025 will likely lead to a wider fiscal deficit and slower-than-expected fiscal consolidation, Moody’s Ratings said on Tuesday, a day after the island nation unveiled its budget.

title: Russia-US agree to work towards ending Ukraine war in landmark talks
byline: Russia and the U.S. agreed Tuesday to start working towards ending the war in Ukraine and improving their diplomatic and economic ties, the two countries’ top diplomats said after talks that reflected an extraordinary about-face in U.S. foreign policy under President Donald Trump.

title: Police Constable wanted over Harak Kata’s failed escape bid arrested in India
byline: Ravindu Sandeepa, the Police Constable (PC) who aided in the escape attempt of notorious drug trafficker Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne alias “Harak Kata” from CID custody and later fled the island, has been arrested in India along with four others.
